word.entryDescription: to bring a child or a thing to school
word.entryExample: My father takes me to school every day.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to say words or have a conversation
word.entryExample: Kim is talking to Lucy.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a tall person, tree or building is greater in height than other people, trees or buildings
word.entryExample: There is a tall tree outside our house.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a hot drink made from dried leaves
word.entryExample: The British drink a lot of tea.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: someone whose job is to teach in a school
word.entryExample: Ms Black is our English teacher.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a group of people who play a sport or game against another group
word.entryExample: I am playing in the school football team.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a soft toy bear
word.entryExample: Lucy likes to play with her teddy.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a device used to show programmes and films, usually for entertainment at home
word.entryExample: The television is in the living rom.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to say something to someone, usually giving details or information
word.entryExample: Can you tell me your name?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 10
word.entryExample: There are ten children in my class.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a sport played on a court in which two or four people use rackets to hit a small ball over a net
word.entryExample: My parents love playing tennis.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a cloth shelter that you can carry with you and put up when you want to stay somewhere
word.entryExample: I slept in a tent on hoiday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in the position of number ten when we count
word.entryExample: The office is on the tenth floor.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: very bad
word.entryExample: It was a terrible holiday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a set of questions or activities designed to measure somebody's knowledge or ability
word.entryExample: We have a maths test on Tuesday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to send somebody a text message on a mobile device
word.entryExample: I sent you a text this morning.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: used to link two things when comparing them
word.entryExample: She's taller than her sister.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you say to show that you are grateful for something they have said or done
word.entryExample: "I made you a cup of tea." "Thank you."
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: informal word for 'thank you'
word.entryExample: "Here are the sausages for you." "Thanks."
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the morning after today
word.entryExample: The next morning the weather was beautiful and we went sailing.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place where you can see a play
word.entryExample: We went to the theatre with friends.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: next; after that
word.entryExample: The next lesson is English then it's music.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: somebody who steals
word.entryExample: The thief stole my bag.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: someone who is thin has a narrow body without any fat on it
word.entryExample: You look very thin in this picture.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an object that you are not naming
word.entryExample: One more thing, please remember to buy a mat for your bedroom.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to have an opinion or belief, or to use your mind
word.entryExample: What do you think about the card we made for you?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in the position of number three when we count
word.entryExample: My birthday is on the third of May.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: needing a drink
word.entryExample: You can drink the mineral water when you're thirsty.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 13
word.entryExample: Thirteen is my lucky number.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 3
word.entryExample: We finish lessons at three.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to make something move through the air, using your hand or arm
word.entryExample: In this game you throw a ball to your friend.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the day after Wednesday
word.entryExample: Today is Thursday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to put things in order or in the right place in a house
word.entryExample: She must tidy the house on Saturdays.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an Asian animal like a large cat with orange and black stripes
word.entryExample: Are there any tigers in Africa?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: feeling sleepy or not having much energy
word.entryExample: I didn't go on the trip because I was very tired.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of bread you heat until it is brown and dry
word.entryExample: Do you want some toast for breakfast?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: on the present day
word.entryExample: It's my birthday today!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: one of five small parts of your body on the end of your foot
word.entryExample: We have ten fingers and ten toes.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: with each other
word.entryExample: Let's go on holiday together!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a round soft red fruit with lots of seeds, which is used as a vegetable
word.entryExample: This tomato soup is delicious.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: on the day after today
word.entryExample: How about going to the beach tomorrow?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: more than is acceptable, suitable or possible
word.entryExample: This car is too slow, let's take the train.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small hard part inside your mouth which you use for biting
word.entryExample: The baby has a new tooth.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a pain in your tooth
word.entryExample: She's got a very bad toothache.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the highest part
word.entryExample: The view from the top of the mountain was amazing.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the highest level in a building
word.entryExample: My bedroom is on the top floor of my house.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small light that is held in the hand and usually gets its power from batteries
word.entryExample: Did you take the torch in your bag?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small animal with a hard shell that moves slowly
word.entryExample: This tortoise is the slowest.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to feel something with your hand
word.entryExample: Can you touch your toes?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of cloth you use to dry yourself when you are wet
word.entryExample: We're going to the beach, so take your towel.
word.label: ydp
